message.content:
<<<api>>>: NullPointerException
<<<code>>>: In the first example, the variable "tile" is just a local variable that holds a reference to each element in the "myTiles" array. When you assign a new Tile object to "tile", it doesn't actually modify the array itself. So when you try to access "this.myTiles[0].getNumber()" in another method, it throws a NullPointerException because the array elements are still null.

In the second example, you are directly modifying the elements of the "myTiles" array by assigning a new Tile object to "this.myTiles[number-1]". This ensures that the array elements are properly initialized and can be accessed without throwing a NullPointerException.

<<<explanation>>>: In the first example, the "tile" variable is just a reference to each element in the "myTiles" array. When you assign a new Tile object to "tile", it doesn't actually modify the array itself. So when you try to access "this.myTiles[0].getNumber()" in another method, it throws a NullPointerException because the array elements are still null.

In the second example, you are directly modifying the elements of the "myTiles" array by assigning a new Tile object to "this.myTiles[number-1]". This ensures that the array elements are properly initialized and can be accessed without throwing a NullPointerException.
